paper_abstract: In deteriorating job scheduling problems, most of the researchers assume that the actual job processing time is a function of its starting time. In this paper, we propose a new deterioration model in which the actual job processing time is a general function of the normal processing time of jobs already processed and its scheduled position at the same time. We show that some single-machine scheduling problems remain polynomially solvable. (C) 2010 Published by Elsevier B.V.
paper_title: Single-machine scheduling with a nonlinear deterioration function
